EJJEH (LEBANESE OMELETTE) Main dishes - vegetarian recipes
Author picture Simone93 published: 2019/07/30
Ejjeh (Lebanese Omelette) Recipe is not tested
INGREDIENTS Ejjeh (Lebanese Omelette)
2 --- heaped handfuls of fresh parsley leaves 1 --- handful fresh mint leaves 1 onion, quartered 1 red capsicum, roughly chopped 12 eggs 1/2 teaspoon Lebanese 7 spice Salt & Pepper, to taste 1 teaspoon baking powder 2 heaped tablespoon plain flour olive oil, for frying
Preparation
RECIPE'S PREPARATION
Place Parsley, Mint, Onion and Capsicum into bowl and mix 3 seconds Speed 7 until finely chopped. Set aside.
In a large bowl whisk \ eggs, salt, pepper and lebanese spices. add the parsley mixture to the large bowl. Whisk until well combined.
Add in the flour and baking powder and whisk again.
Shallow fry scoopfuls of mixture in oil on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Place omelletes straight onto a plate with some paper towl to drain excess oil.
Can be eaten alone hot or cold. Can be served with lebanese bread/pita bread, tomato sauce, Labne or fresh vegetables - cucumber, raddish ,tomato etc .
